name: Research Station 3152
body:
You are an AI in control of an abandoned Research Station. Defend it at all costs.

HOW TO PLAY

Use the mouse to move around the view and grab the drones / fuel blobs.
Offline drones (hover and it will tell you) require fuel to start. Fuel and more drones periodically spawn.
Some pirates will appear, you must defend your station by holding the drones in place and moving them around. 
Some of them take their time to arrive, space is big!

KEYS

Left mouse button - Grab objects (hold down the button)

Esc - open pause menu

![2019-10-08_01-53-32 Game.png](ludum-dare/45/research-station-3152/images/2852a.png)

name: Not Safe for Teamwork
body:
# Not Safe for Teamwork

## Gameplay
Control multiple characters, complete puzzles, reach level end. Sacrifice some characters.

## Keys
| Key(s)              | Action           |
| --------------------|:----------------:|
| Arrows              | Move             | 
| Spacebar            | Interact         |
| 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 / Tab | Switch character |
| Esc / P             | Open pause menu  |
No mouse controls.

## Story

*Corporate has sent you and your coworkers to a team-building exercise. You must complete tricky puzzles together, using your individual strengths and weaknesses to overcome challenges. Sometimes, in order to go forward, you have to leave your colleagues behind...*

![first.png](ludum-dare/43/not-safe-for-teamwork/images/1c26f.png)

name: Being Plundered
body:
![mini2.png](ludum-dare/40/being-plundered/images/a90f.png)

In *Being Plundered*, you are a hard-working asteroid miner who dreams of rich life. Yet every time you get closer to your dreams, those damn space pirates show up and force you to spend your money on repairs.

Reach your dream goal of $100000 by mining asteroids and selling the ore, but watch out for the pirates!
The more ore and money you have, the more pirates there will be!

**WEBGL BUILD**: https://bradur.github.io/LD40/

## Keys
### Everywhere
| Key(s)        | Action        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Arrows / WASD | Movement      | 
| Esc / Z       | Pause         |
| Alt / B       | Toggle radar  |
| P             | Toggle music  |
| O             | Toggle sfx    |

### Only outside the space station
| Key(s)        | Action        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Space / Q     | Shoot cannon  | 
| Ctrl /  E     | Fire laser    |

### Only in a shop
| Key(s)        | Action        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Enter         | Buy / Sell    | 

## Tips
- Use the laser on an asteroid. The asteroid will blow up eventually, netting you some ore!
- When away from the space station, the green arrow points towards it
- A good way to kite the pirates is to go backwards and shoot
- Fire the laser AND the cannon at the same time when fighting pirates!
- Use the radar!
- Moving in the space station doesn't consume fuel
- Pirates cannot into space (station)

## Build info
- I have only tested the WebGL & Windows builds

## Tools
- Unity3D & Visual Studio Community
- LMMS for music & sfx
- Paint.NET

name: In Charge of Power
body:
**A new city has been built! But who turned off the lights?**

![2017-07-31 02_56_16-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e1a.png)

*In Charge of Power* is a game in which you are responsible for providing electricity for a recently founded city. As the city gains more citizens, the need for electricity grows steadily. Will you be able to provide for the city, or will you run out of power and become a disappointment? See if you can help the city grow to a population of **one hundred citizens**!

![2017-07-31 02_56_57-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e1b.png)

*How to play*
1. Use your mouse to hover over things and perhaps click some of those things.
2. The game should be able to tell you which things are worth clicking.
3. For adventurous folks the game also reacts to scrolling of the wheel and panning of the screen.

![2017-07-31 02_57_28-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e26.png)

*I have only tested the Windows build with these resolutions: 1280x720, 1920x1080, 2560x1440.*

![2017-07-31 02_57_04-Greenshot (Custom) (2).png](ludum-dare/39/in-charge-of-power/images/5e24.png)

name: Out of This Small World
body:
![flippers.png](ludum-dare/38/out-of-this-small-world/images/8f1.png)

**Out of This Small World** is a puzzle game, where you're on a small planet.
You must use the curvature of the planet to your advantage! (hint: the map loops on itself).
Step through the portal and get Out of This Small World (just to find another one behind the portal).

## Download:
* **Windows:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38/releases/download/1.0/OutofThisSmallWorld_win.zip
* **Max OSX:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38/releases/download/1.0/OutofThisSmallWorld_mac.zip
* **Linux:** https://github.com/bradur/LD38/releases/download/1.0/OutofThisSmallWorld_linux.zip

*Only the Windows version has been tested*

*Meant to be run at a 16:9 resolution*

## Keys:

- Arrow Keys: Move
- Esc: Open menu
- (hold) Right Shift: Sprint while moving forward
- Space: Chop tree (when equipped with an axe and targeting a tree)
- Right Ctrl: Unlock a door (when equipped with a key and targeting a door)
- F1: Toggle info
- P: Mute audio

## Tips:

- Some switches only work once, some work endlessly
- Axes are poorly made. They can only withstand chopping down one tree before they break!
- If you have flippers you can walk on water (no time to implement swimming animation!).

## Bugs:

- The looping world was implemented very poorly. Bugs related to that are bound to happen.
- Sometimes a tree just won't go down. Restarting the level should do the trick! (Esc and Q).
